snippet: Current law does not protect against discrimination based on sexual orientation or gender identity, and legislation to do so, which Mr. Obama endorses, lacks sufficient votes in Congress.
abstract: Pres Obama will not sign an executive order banning discrimination against gay, bisexual and transgender people in workplaces with federal contracts; decision vexes Obama's supporters in the gay community, some of whom have been a source of campaign contributions.
lead_paragraph: Current law does not protect against discrimination based on sexual orientation or gender identity, and legislation to do so, which Mr. Obama endorses, lacks sufficient votes in Congress.

headline.seo: Obama Won’t Order Ban on Gay Bias by Employers
headline.main: Obama Won’t Order Ban on Gay Bias by Employers
headline.print_headline: Obama Won’t Order Ban On Gay Bias by Employers
